intro: Allantoma aulacocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit allantoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive pinnate structure and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed capsule that matures in autumn, and the plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. Allantoma aulacocarpa is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
